number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
Early Access Review
								OK... this game is awesomeI really like this game. The gameplay and controls are simple, its not like other games where the game forces a tutorial at you so you can learn the game. The fun thing is to learn about the game as you play.The game is also challanging at some points, but that is a good thing for a game like this.The art style is cool with the glowing lights and the blockshaped world.I like the weapons, I wish they would make more.If you like the binding of Isaac then you are gonna live this game, there are very much alikeThe soundtrack is also AWESOME!!The issues that I have with  with this game is that it can be a bit slow at some points, because sometimes you have to go through many rooms that you have already cleared to buy items and get all the way back to the next floorAlso this is just a personal issue... my computer does not go well with this engine, but I found a way to solve itI recommend this game to people who likes fun and challanging games. This game is addictive and has a lot of replayabillity.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 24, 2013
Early Access Review
								Although I have not gotten very far in the game (level 3), it is quite easy for me to say that it is a lot of fun.Here are a few positive things I'd like to point out:-Game mechanics are incredibly simple and easy to grasp-Impressive enemy variety-Weapons are fun and varied-Power ups and stores offer many options for players-Dungeon designs are varied-Success is reliant on player skill-Lighting effects are cool-Art style is cool-Music is cool, and fits the action-HUD is unobtrusive and informative-Boss, and mini-boss, battles are fun and creative-Game is cool (haha)Here are a couple negative things:-No scoring system or scoreboards-Only a few music tracks-No achievements (not a neccesity, but it might be cool)Overall I've had a lot of fun with the game so far, its easy to jump in and play for a bit. I am also quite excited for the co-op update.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								What can be said about this game that hasn't already been said. When I first saw this I rolled my eyes and said great blocky graphics.... again! Now let me say that i am not a graphic ♥♥♥♥♥. I enjoy 2d games over all and I am nuts for roguelikes. So I saw this game on the Humble Rogulike Bundle and said, "Hey, why not?"This game is absolutly amazing. It combines the fast paced FPS of classic Doom with the randomized dungeon crawling of Roguelikes flawlessly and the visual style is mind blowing! It is unforgiving and should not be played by someone expecting deep story and lore. This is simply going room to room killing... monsters of some sort for loot and coins. I don't think i've gotten past four rooms before getting slayed. In Paranauutical, it's never been so fun to die.

								Very fun intersting game, which you mostly depend on mobility to survive and dodge attacks. With 5 interesting and balanced classes you are sure to find at least one that you like. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
Early Access Review
								Not what you'd expect from a game called "Paranautical Activity". At first glance, you hear and see it as a horror shooter game, but when you see someone play it, or play it for yourself, you realize it is everything but that. Paranautical Activity (you have no idea how hard that is to type) is a blocky, retro type fps shooter. This particular game is not meant to be played for hours at a time, in my opinion. Because you can die so quickly and easily, I havent played it for more than 15 minutes at a time. Of course, Paranautical Activity has a lot of work that must be done to stand up to games such as Doom, Shadow Warrior, etc. I do personally think this game can stand up to and potentially overthrow the games mentioned before in Retro shooters.Now, about the game.This game has every element of a good shooter, but these elements need to be executed better. Don't get me wrong, I love this game. I play it whenever I'm bored, and it is a very good time waster (I say that in the best way possible). You are dropped down into a series of rooms by a red elevator. If you enter a room, the doors will shut and you can't leave until you kill all the enemies. Every once in a while, you'll come across a boss room. The boss's health will be displayed on the top of the screen and when you kill it, the doors open again as if you're in a normal room. Occasionally, you will stumble upon a shop. These shops are randomized with useful/useless items that you can pick up and use in battle rooms. If you buy an item, it disappears from the pedastle.Overall, I like the game. It's in early access, so the kinks and bugs I meantioned earlier will most likely be fixed. It's on sale a lot, and it's even worth the $10 it's usually priced at.9/10, buy it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
												Pros:- Decent music- Decent enemy variety- Items and other stuff to find through out the dungeons- OK boss fightsCons:- All of the weapons suck, usually difficult to aim or use, lack impact and are never multi-purpose. Trying to use any of the 4 main weapons to fight most of the enemies is a real challenge. - Classes are pretty useless. They all seem to be extremes with only 1 balanced class. Other classes include, guy with 1 hp, guy who moves slower than a rock, guy with ultra useless weapon.- Extremely repetitive locations. Every room is the same as the last and it's the same shade of blue most of the game. - Floaty controls, the movement just feels wrong. View bobbing is annoying too.- Colliding with oddly placed staircases and other pointless structures.Overall:I don't recommend this game. Each play session is so damn short it's ridiculous. No matter how many times i try and with any of the classes, I rarely make it to the 3rd floor. Often getting hit by things I can't even see or are unable to dodge with the slower classes. It lacks content, isn't very fun and gets very repetitive very quickly. Unless you like shooting the same enemies in the same rooms with the same 4 textures using awful weapons, stay away from this game. There are many better shooters out there. The roguelike elements aren't used in any interesting way here either. Just another excuse to stretch out a game's length when it otherwise lacks content and substance.

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												I really want to reccommend this game, but the bad just ended up outweighing the good. Is it a fun game? I'd say so. It's fast paced, action-packed and the graphics are surprisingly unique. However, there's just too much I personally don't enjoy for me to keep playing. I'm all for hard games, but in some parts, the difficulty spikes in unfair ways. I'm not even talking about the bosses, which, while cliche (flying skulls? really?), are fun and pleasantly challenging. I'm referring to enemies like the land sharks that are nearly impossible to hit and can grind your health away in seconds after noiselessly charging you in packs of 5 or 6. Another issue I had was the item system. Some items, when activated, seem to do absolutely nothing. I'm sure they were performing some function, but some feedback or even a short bio displayed when picking up the item would have been appreciated. Also why does the sword use ammo? That's nitpicking, I'll admit, but something just seems odd about that to me, especially since it appears to be just a standard medieval sword. While fun, Paranautical Activity doesn't really enough to keep me playing for more than half an hour or so.Score: 5/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 27, 2015
												Oh boy this game. Originally taken down due to ♥♥♥♥♥♥  devs, and reuploaded for god knows what reason. I purchased this game when there was a rouge-like sale going on, and even though it was only about $2.50, I regret it. Now, before I go one, I have to preface this by saying that I played the Tank 99% of the time. I greatly enjoy heavy characters, and From the stats I thought I would enjoy playing as him the most. I did, as the others were♥♥♥♥♥♥ However, whenever the Tank fires his shotgun, theres a full second of the game registering the damage or if it hit or whatever, where the game entirely freezes up. This mostly happens on larger enemies, but it makes the game utterly unplayable due to it. You stop, and the game doesnt. Id be fine with this if it was purposefully implemented, but its clearly not as when you attack smaller enemies or hit with fewer pellets, the game doesnt freeze. The cannon on the other hand is completely worthless even without a glitch, not that it doesnt have one. When firing the cannon, sometimes there will be a visible projectile but sometimes there wont be a charge up time OR a projectile, just immediately dealing damage to whatevers in front of you. It makes the gun entirely unpredictable, which is not a good thing in a game about avoiding death. Bomb's usefulness varies from very good against slower enemies, to absolutely worthless on bosses and slightly faster enemies. A major MAJOR problem in the game, however, is the fact that not every class can beat every boss. While playing as the slow Tank, I encountered a snail-like boss that immediately curled up and unrelentingly rolled at me, much faster than I could move out of its path while it immediately snaps to wherever I run, making the entire fight a DPS race which is NOT A GOOD THING. It might be that I just didnt figure out some secret strategy of beating it, but that's a moot point. There is no point in making a game unplayable just for the sake of difficulty. There's some good things about the game, for as much as Im harshing on it: The concept of an FPS Roguelike is a very fun one that has tons of potential, of which they use none. The graphics are very adorable, giving even what are supposed to be hideous monsters a very huggable and blocky appearance. It is an overused artstyle, but I have a weakness for it and enjoy when it is used.Also the music is ♥♥♥♥ing terrible.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
												This is a game with a lot of struggles. It was originally denied access to Greenlight, then it was allowed and greenlit and released, then it was pulled from Steam and then it was put back on Steam. I originally got the game at launch. But let's put that aside and talk about what the game IS and not its troubled release history.Paranautical Activity is a first person roguelike. From a gameplay perspective it borrows a lot from The Binding of Isaac, notably the room grid approach where the player needs to defeat all enemies in a room to progress instead of moving freely in a continuous level like in other roguelikes. And like Binding of Isaac, each floor has a boss at the end as well as optional minibosses. The first first person perspective alone and the three-dimensional design of rooms makes the game very action oriented and keeps you on your toes. There are also multiple "characters" to choose from, each with radically different weapons, so there is variety in gameplay. The presentation of the game is pretty neat, making use of voxels to render everything. And I can honestly say I had a lot of fun playing this game. If you want a very action oriented roguelike with FPS control, then I say give this game a try.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Well, to be honest I am a bit divided about this game.  I really wanted to reccommend it to everyone, it looked and functioned for the most part how I expected it would.  A simple, pixelated shooter with Rogue like elements.  That being said..the developers promised multiplayer multiple times.  I bought into this game rather late into it's development.  However it was promised on Steam, and judging by various Forum posts it was promised elsewhere as well.  However, it is not just the Multiplayer that detracts from this game for me.  It's just not that fun..well, at all after awhile.  The challenge overides the novelty of it all and even though a rogue-like seems fun..it doesn't quite add up.  Progressing a level or two, getting killed and then reset all the way back to the beginning can be a bit annoying.  Not just that though, I mean there is no story to the game which for the most part is barebones as it is.  The developers have also been agressive towards player criticism in the past..never a good sign when you can't take criticism.  2 out of 5.

Early Access Review
								This is a very fun, but very unfinished game. Just know that going in. The game is difficult, close to Quake's "nightmare" setting, and—true to the roguelike ethos—rarely gives you a fair fight. Bad runs are still fun, and good runs are exhilarating. On downside, the multiplayer coop has been cancelled (which sucks but it's not for the developers' lack of trying). Two more patches are planned before it's complete; but your money gets you solid, hard-as-diamonds old school FPS gameplay. And that ain't bad.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 27, 2015
												A bumping soundtrack and fast paced, hard hitting weapons with cool particle effects, a selection of weird bosses and a handful of surreal supernatural atmosphere all come together and make Paranautical Activity a make a great fast paced FPS Dungeon Crawler with roguelike elements that I still have fun blasting out a quick game or two in here and there.Paranautical Activity began to pick up traction within the Steam community, but then went off the rails after one of the two developers went on a childish twitter rampage against Steam and had the game pulled after a comment about killing Gabe Newell[ http]/Much like Fez, despite all the nonsense and bad publicity because of a developer, Paranautical Activity is still a pretty unique, adrenalin pumping fast blast of a game.Highlights* Excellent timing/pace and very quick off the mark* Unique enemies and design* One helluva SoundtrackMistakes* There's a sentiment from Steam gamers to avoid this title because of the twitter comments and attitude of the former developer. While I personally think the former developer was a childish idiot, I separate my choice to purchase a product from any attitude or conceptions I have on people involved with the creation of a product. For some people the attitudes of people working for a company go hand in hand with their choice to purchase products from that company, and may take issue. However the the developers are no longer involved and the title has now near-completely changed hands.* There are noticably too few enemies, and arguably a lack of weapons, which means gameplay becomes repetitive after long stretches.RecommendationsAvailable on Steam for £6.99/8.99€/$9.99 at the time of review, which feels very fair. It's very replayable and I often find myself coming back to run through a quick few floors. It's often available cheaper via various Indie Bundles, so search around.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 29, 2015
												This is a game with a lot of struggles. It was originally denied access to Greenlight, then it was allowed and greenlit and released, then it was pulled from Steam and then it was put back on Steam. I originally got the game at launch. But let's put that aside and talk about what the game IS and not its troubled release history.Paranautical Activity is a first person roguelike. From a gameplay perspective it borrows a lot from The Binding of Isaac, notably the room grid approach where the player needs to defeat all enemies in a room to progress instead of moving freely in a continuous level like in other roguelikes. And like Binding of Isaac, each floor has a boss at the end as well as optional minibosses. The first first person perspective alone and the three-dimensional design of rooms makes the game very action oriented and keeps you on your toes. There are also multiple "characters" to choose from, each with radically different weapons, so there is variety in gameplay. The presentation of the game is pretty neat, making use of voxels to render everything. And I can honestly say I had a lot of fun playing this game. If you want a very action oriented roguelike with FPS control, then I say give this game a try.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
Early Access Review
While others dislike this game because of the lack of updates and the poor feature discontinuation of the devlopers, I personally enjoy this game, although I am very very disapointed at their discontinuation of the multiplayer (Thats why you don't announce a feature until AFTER you confirm in your ability to be able to create it). From the very excellent gameplay to the fun and varied bosses that you encounter.NOTE: This review will change as the game changes, this review is as of 1.8PROS:+ Classic FPS gameplay that you've come to love including Doom and Quake, with over 10 upgrades and fast paced action that many people crave, and NON REGENERATING HEALTH! YES!+ The game is randomly generated and thus there are thousnads of possibilities for level layouts which is actually done really well, with every corner you turn being completley surprising. With over 50 differnt room enviroments its hard to see the same rooms twice on the same floor.+ There are many different bosses that you encounter with over 10 in the game, each with their own moves which are pretty insane to watch, with balls of glowing lime green light flying everywhere as you attempt to dodge them with precise movement, just hoping it will die shortly.+ Variety is a strong point in this game, with many many enemy types and each room having a random layout of enemy in every room, each enemy has its own attack patterns with ninjas that teleport to you in a blaze of white voxel blocks to sharks that dive into the floor leaching up onto you after they swim.CONS: (Unfortinutley this game)+ The music is boring a repedative with only a small handful of tracks that all sound the same.+ The game has its fair share of glitches (Doors closing before you walk into them causing you to be stuck) But it is early access so I can cut it some slack+ The developers have no clue what the hell they want in this game, from discontinuing multiplayer to saying updates would come quickly and sadly have come at a crawl.+ The level's appearance doesnt change often enough (the first 5 levels use the same wall texture and gets bland and tidious after a while) And the bosses aren't really seen as bosses as nothing happens when you enter the room it just spawns and a health bar appears, a nice boss spawning track or some sound effects would really help.+ Movement doesn't feel right, the lack of bobbing correctly to the very slow walking speed at the start doesn't work well with a game that depends on fast paced movementOVERALL:This game does have plenty of falws in it from glitches and the lazy developers but I keep coming back to this game, why? Because, its fun gameplay, great level layout and enemy variety really makes this game fun to me. I recomend only getting this game if it goes on sale in its current state, because currently it is a very fun game but there isn't enough variety from its very huge variety to make it worth it.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Well, to be honest I am a bit divided about this game.  I really wanted to reccommend it to everyone, it looked and functioned for the most part how I expected it would.  A simple, pixelated shooter with Rogue like elements.  That being said..the developers promised multiplayer multiple times.  I bought into this game rather late into it's development.  However it was promised on Steam, and judging by various Forum posts it was promised elsewhere as well.  However, it is not just the Multiplayer that detracts from this game for me.  It's just not that fun..well, at all after awhile.  The challenge overides the novelty of it all and even though a rogue-like seems fun..it doesn't quite add up.  Progressing a level or two, getting killed and then reset all the way back to the beginning can be a bit annoying.  Not just that though, I mean there is no story to the game which for the most part is barebones as it is.  The developers have also been agressive towards player criticism in the past..never a good sign when you can't take criticism.  2 out of 5.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is a very fun, but very unfinished game. Just know that going in. The game is difficult, close to Quake's "nightmare" setting, and—true to the roguelike ethos—rarely gives you a fair fight. Bad runs are still fun, and good runs are exhilarating. On downside, the multiplayer coop has been cancelled (which sucks but it's not for the developers' lack of trying). Two more patches are planned before it's complete; but your money gets you solid, hard-as-diamonds old school FPS gameplay. And that ain't bad.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												As of now, I find Paranautical Activity to be lack luster if anything. A rogue-like FPS could have been really intuative, yet the controls feel clumsy and the difficulty feels to brash.It tries to play on an "Items to make it easier" system like Binding of Issac yet going room to room is unpredictable and ends up biting you in the♥♥♥♥♥ Sure Binding of Issac can screw you over if you explore but that's usually in later levels, Paranautical Activity does this on the first level!As I said the controls feel clunky (At least it does on my 360 controller) and the game tries to be too fast paced for it's on good. Doom was great as a fast paced game, but yet Doom didn't have unpassable rooms because you didn't defeat all the monsters (not all the time at least from my memory.) There is a sprint button, yet it completely ♥♥♥♥s with your aim. Doom also had a sprint command but in Doom you can't look up or down and your weapon "auto-locks) on the enemies you aim at. Over all Paranautical Activity is taking too much influence from other games too the point where it is completely miss using what concepts it's taking. Difficulty in a game is fine when presented in increments, but I haven't even made it past the first level.

content:
Posted: March 17, 2016
												Paranautical Activity ReviewFor me: 7/10 For others 3/10Let's just be honest right off the bat: you might not like this game. It's not nearly as replayable as other roguelikes, maybe 20 hours at most. it's very repetetive, which is something I personally am okay with, but many people aren't. The power ups aren't interesting, the gameplay is pretty good, even if it's just strafing in a circle for every boss or room, dodging is annoying especially with homing shots. for homing shots, the only way to dodge it is cling against the wall so the bullet flies into the wall. There are some things in the game that make it very laggy, making me rush to kill the boss before it lags too hard ( talking about the snail boss ). it's not well optimized for sure. But it's fun to play in my opinion! Like, it's almost literally binding of Isaac in FPS form! If you are fine with all these cons, then this game should be plenty fun for you!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 6, 2016
												7/10A fun roguelike shooter with pixelated graphics. Not the best in its genre, but fun nonetheless.In Paranautical Activity, you have a few classes to pick and they differ in speed, damage, fire rate, health and starting weapons. After picking your character, you'll be traversing through randomly generated rooms, defeating enemies on the way, collecting money and using said money to buy upgrades when you come to a room with items for sale. At the end of each level, you'll fight a boss before progressing to the next level.The main issue with the game is that it can be very confusing at times. As a roguelike game, it's expected that the game won't hold your hand and a lot of trial-and-error will be involved, but even then the game does little to tell you what each item does. The game could certainly benefit with being at least slightly more descriptive.Another issue is that because rooms look mostly the same and enemies repeat themselves a lot as well, the game can become quite repetitive.In comparison to games like Tower of Guns or Ziggurat, it doesn't stand out, but it's still recommended for those who enjoy roguelike shooters.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 16, 2016
												Paranautical Activity is truly something special. I remember back when the game was in early access and how the developers were pretty much neglecting their fanbase. I think it took them like 8 months to fix a couple of bugs yet everyone was in shock that the game wasn't abandoned. Now, I haven't really followed the controversy surrounding the game since I'm not interested in developer drama but I am glad that the current developers are actually putting effort into it. The game itself, to me personally, is nothing more than a nice time waster. Kind of like The Binding of Isaac, you play in randomly generated levels with rooms you must clear in order to advance to the next floor. What differentiates it from other so-called "time wasters", however, is the pure adrenaline you get from fighting multiple enemies or hugh mungus bosses. Even though I haven't played many rogue likes (mostly because I'm not a fan of the genre), I think this game is a great introduction. Your reflexes and coordination will be put to the test, along with your sense of direction in the sometimes overwhelmingly confusing levels. The voxel graphics are nice to look at for what they are though the level design is pretty bland and not memorable in the slightest.I'd personally recommend the game if you find it on sale. I see a lot of people saying Ziguratt is better and even though I haven't played it, they seem like two entirely different games. While there are certainly better games than this one, I think you will have a good time with Paranautical Activity.

content:
Posted: November 17, 2016
												I'm not a big fan of roguelikes, and I'm not very good at them.  This game has a lot of good things going for it, but fell just short of being great.  If you're a fan of roguelike fps games, then it's worth a try.   However, be aware that the learning curve may be steep.  There's no single starting character that is well balanced for someone new to the game.Pros-Great music.  The music may be the best part, imo.  I don't know if I'd call it dubstep, as the outline has.-The voxel artwork is interesting, and the bosses are all pretty great in their own ways.-The Seafarers Guide pdf is useful and the mini documentary is interesting. (To find it, right click your game and click properties, then click the "local files" tab and "browse local files")-I believe a lot of thought was put into the pickups and weapons and effects and differentiating objects from each other.Cons-There's no well balanced character for a begginning player to pick up the game quickly with.-It's not obvious what pickups do.  The seafarers guide will tell you, and google might.  -A lot of pickups can be detrimental to gameplay, and those seem to be the items I get most.  For example, I seem to get a lot of slow down items when I'm the tank until I move too slow to get out of the way of anything.-When there are a lot of particles on the screen it can be hard to tell what's going on (this may just be an unavoidable side effect of bullet hell shooters)-The menus can feel a little cheap.  I can't put my finger on why exactly.  But they're menus, so they don't really matter.  They are the introduction to the game.  Also,  the Unity frontloader always feels kind of amateur(cookie cutter) to me. Moving the controller options and video options into the main game menu and dropping the frontloader would have remedied that.  Again, it really has no effect on gameplay, so it's not a big deal to me.-On my machine, in OSX, there seems to be some issues with music lagging and possibly other kinds of lag.  An fps counter would be nice, so I could know for sure.  This could just be my machine, or just OSX.  I don't know.-The controversy surrounding this game is highly disconcerting.  I hope those at fault learned the right lessons from the experience, and that everyone involved was compensated fairly for their efforts.Games are hard as hell to make, and overall I feel like this was a really good effort.  Without the controversy, and with some incremental improvements, I feel like this game could have gone much further, and been a lot more successful.
